data.title: Cristiano Venturini awarded CEO of the Year in the Design category
data.meta_description: In the context of the CEO Italian Summit & Awards 2022 entitled  The transformation agenda  iGuzzini lighting CEO Cristiano Venturini took part in the discussion table with other international entrepreneurs and was awarded one of the 15 most innovative and successful Italian CEOs of 2022, in the “Design” category.
data.text:
At the 2022 CEO Italian Summit & Awards entitled "The transformation agenda", iGuzzini CEO Cristiano Venturini took part in a round table discussion with other international entrepreneurs and was awarded as one of the 15 most innovative and successful Italian CEOs of 2022.

The event held at the Hotel Principe di Savoia in Milan, was attended by over 200 CEOs and entrepreneurs: a "cross industry" talk on the expected macro trends and key issues of global business, together with representatives of international economic and financial institutions, experts, academics and authoritative journalists.

In his remarks during the panel discussion, CEO Cristiano Venturini explained the company's evolution strategy, the demand chain expansion that has occurred through brand repositioning through growth drivers; Design, Culture, Connectivity, and Sustainability growth, and talked about the WCL continuous improvement system, developed internally after reaching the Bronze Level of the WCM (Fiat Chrysler).

The CEO Summit concluded with the awarding, in collaboration with Forbes Italy, of the CEOs representing the "captains of Made in Italy": Giuseppe Amitrano, CEO of DILS (category: Real Estate), Andrea Patricelli Malizia, CEO of Iama Therapeutics (category: Life Science), Cristiano Venturini, Group CEO of IGuzzini (category: Design), Pietro Labriola, Chief Executive Officer of TIM (category: TLC), Vera Fiorani, CEO and General Director of RFI (category: Infrastructure), Carlo Luzzatto, CEO of Impresa Pizzarotti & C. (category: Made in Italy), Federico Protto, CEO of Retelit (category: ICT), Stephane Cluzet, General Manager Italy Bacardi-Martini Group (category: Manager Straniero), Maurizio Marinella, CEO of E. Marinella (category: Fashion), Marco Tripi, CEO of Gruppo Almaviva S.p.A. (category: Innovation), Andrea Quadrio Curzio, CEO, Chief Experience and Operations of QC Terme spas and resort (category: Wellness), Massimo De Iasi, CEO of Socotec Italia (category: Sustainability), Giacomo Gigantiello, CEO of AXA Italia Group (category: Insurance), Päivi Kerkola, Country President of Pfizer Italy (category: Pharma), Renato Mazzoncini, CEO and General Director of A2A (category: Energy).

The most innovative top managers of the year have distinguished themselves through competence, professionalism and boldness in order to make their companies not only more competitive in global markets, but also environments capable of improving the quality of life of both their employees and the territory in which they operate every day.

The CEO Italian Summit & Awards 2022 was organized by Business International - Fiera Milano, in collaboration with Forbes Italy.
